TopicTitle: Which modeling program is most like solidworks or pro-e?

Articles.Content: I've been wanting to get into making parts for a while now, but I don't really know much about modeling. I've got plenty of experience with SolidWorks and Pro-Engineering so anything similar to those would be preferable. I also have an Autodesk license if that helps.

I would stick with SolidWorks if your familiar with it and then just use other modeling programs to convert/texture/etc. I use an ancient version of Zmodeler for most of what I make since I'm used to it, then things get moved through Blender or Lightwave for conversion. If I had to suggest something I would stress learning something main stream like Max or Lightwave. Learning new modeling programs can take a large investment of time, so if your going to learn something make it something that would like nice on a resume.
